task.summary: Default task
New Maven project plus added all required junit, hibernate etc dependencies to the pom.xml file.
Corrected typo!
Added hibernate.cfg.xml file to resources folder (main and test). Added HibernateUtil class to db package.
Added DBHelper class, with methods for saveOrUpdate(), Delete(), find(), getAll() plus reusable methods: getList() and getUnique().
Added skeleton classes to main/java/models: Studio, Film, Actor, Director Added skeleton TDD test classes to test/java/models: Studio, Film, Actor, Director
Added skeleton Runner class with a psvm main method declared.

Added properties: id, name & budget to Studio class and all getters/setters,then added Hibernate annotation so that the properties for an instantiation of the Studio class can successfully be stored in the database.
Added skeleton Employee class and TDD test class.
Added CRUD tests to StudioTest class.

Added properties to Film class, plus constructors and getters/setters. Added Hibernate annotation for getters in Film class. Added annotations etc to create a one to many relationship between Studio and Film classes.
Added some studios/films to Runner to test the database is updated as expected.
Added CRUD tests to FilmTest class.

Added an abstract 'superclass' called Employee - plus constructors/getters/setters. Added an Actor class, which inherits from Employee - plus constructors/getters/setters. Added Hibernate annotation so that just an Actor table is generated that includes columns from the Employee superclass. Will do the same for the Director table. As this is slightly more efficient when querying back data from the database.

Added a ManyToMany mapping table between Actor and Film. Decided to do this specifically for Actor, rather than Employee, because it will be more efficient query-wise to fetch films for the Actor, rather than having to figure out first whether the Employee is an Actor or a Director.

Added DBHelper method addActorToFilm, to enable us to populate the new many-to-many mapping table in the database.
Added addActor() and addFilm() methods to Film and Actor classes respectively, to populate their internal ArrayLists for actors, films respectively.
Added CRUD tests for Actor to ActorTest class.
Added Director class, and getter/setters. Updated a Director property to Film class, and updated Film instantiations to include Director argument.
Added <Class>DBTest classes - so I can factor out explicit DB tests from model tests.

Separated out DB and non-DB tests for Actor class. Added a few more tests. Updated ManyToMany Hibernate annotation for actor_film table to be EAGER, and also added a cascade condition - to see if we can delete the Actor and it's entry from the join table (needs more work - not quite working yet).
Separated out DB and non-DB tests for Studio class. Added a few more tests. Added addFilm() method to Studio class. Added addFilmToStudio() method to DBHelper class.
Separated out DB and non-DB tests for Film class. Added a few more tests.
Removed EmployeeTest class - as ActorTest and DirectorTest will cover these tests. Removed redundant class instances from ActorDBTest, to simplify code.
Added tests to DirectorDBTest and DirectorTest classes.
Removed comment line.
Removed addFilmToStudio, as this is done by hibernate by the onetomany mapping! Removed addDirectorToFilm, as this is done when a film is instantiated (as an arg)!
Added comments to explain why the 2 commented out tests would not work.
Added wages property to abstract Employee class, initialised to zero, plus getter and setter - where the setter increments the wages with the passed in argument. Added model and DB tests.

Added the following methods:
DBHelper class: payEmployees() Employee class: increaseWages() Studio class: decreaseBudget()
And added DB and model tests to StudioDBTest, ActorTest and StudioTest respectivetly.
